citations.narrative:
On August 19, 2024, a kestrel was on exhibit at the county fair when startled by a photographer. The kestrel reacted by
leaping off its perch. The jesses attached to a leash broke and the kestrel flew to the top of a light pole. Multiple capture
methods were implemented over a 6-hour period, but the bird evaded capture with each attempt and flew away. Park
Rangers and a falconer set-up baited traps and searched for the kestrel for a week as witnesses reported seeing and
hearing the bird. Despite these efforts, the kestrel was not recovered. At the time of inspection, it has been about 3 weeks
since the kestrel was seen or heard. Improper handling of animals increases the risk of escape. The facility must reassess
their tethering process to ensure birds are handled as carefully as possible to minimize trauma and unnecessary
discomfort during public exhibition. Correct by September 30, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
